message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC 

This paper deals with computer vision tasks such as scene understanding, object tracking, and activity recognition, which are typically associated with the computer vision sub-category cs.CV. The paper proposes a new semi-Siamese Convolutional Neural Network architecture to address the challenge of establishing person-level correspondences across first- and third-person videos, which involves learning a joint embedding space for first- and third-person videos. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning sub-category cs.MM and the machine learning sub-category cs.LG. The paper also involves designing a new triplet loss function, which is a common technique in deep learning and suggests that the paper may belong to the artificial intelligence sub-category cs.AI. Finally, the paper deals with wearable cameras, which suggests that it may also belong to the human-computer interaction sub-category cs.HC.
